item.title: French poll shows far-right leader Bardella winning presidential election
item.description: French pollster Odoxa predicted for the first time that 30-year-old far-right leader Jordan Bardella would win the next presidential election, scheduled in 2027, no matter who his opponents would be. The current president of far-right National Rally (RN) party, and heir to long-time leader Marine

item.title: 'Return' to China not an option for Taiwan's people, premier says
item.description: Taiwan Premier Cho Jung-tai said on Tuesday that a "return" to China is not an option for the island's 23 million people, after Chinese President Xi Jinping pressed his country's sovereignty claims in a call with U.S. President Donald Trump. Xi told Trump on Monday that Taiwan's "return to China"

item.title: Well-marked low over Bay likely to intensify: Met office
item.description:
The well-marked low over South Andaman Sea and adjoining area persisted over the same region and is likely to move west-northwestwards and intensify further, according to Bangladesh Meteorological Department (BMD).
Besides, another low-pressure area has formed over southwest Bay and

item.title: Thousands mourn Hezbollah commander killed in Israeli airstrike
item.description:
Thousands of people on Monday attended the funeral organized by the militant Hezbollah group for its top military commander, a day after he was killed in an Israeli airstrike on a southern suburb of Beirut.
Hezbollah supporters walked by Haytham Tabtabai’s coffin, draped in the group

item.title: Unregulated poultry farms push Feni into a growing environmental crisis
item.description:
Unplanned, unregulated and unapproved poultry farms across Feni district are triggering severe environmental pollution, disrupting local biodiversity and putting thousands of residents at risk, according to locals and officials.
Residents have filed repeated complaints with government offi

item.title: Trump begins process of labeling Muslim Brotherhood chapters as terrorist
item.description: US President Donald Trump on Monday began the process of designating certain Muslim Brotherhood chapters as foreign terrorist organisations and specially designated global terrorists, a move that would bring sanctions against one of the Arab world's oldest and most influential Islamist movements.

item.title: Australian Senate suspends far-right leader over 'disrespectful' burqa stunt
item.description: Australia's Senate on Tuesday suspended far-right Senator Pauline Hanson for seven sitting days after she wore a burqa to Parliament as a political prop in her campaign to ban the Muslim garment in public, triggering condemnation from lawmakers. Hanson wore the burqa in the upper house on Monday a

item.title: Ageing populations a 'ticking time bomb' for GDP growth, says EBRD
item.description: Countries must act now to keep slowing population growth from wreaking havoc on their long-term economic prospects, the European Bank for Reconstruction and Development said in a semi-annual report on Tuesday. The report said ageing populations have already begun to hinder economic growth in some

item.title: Don’t hire politically linked election observers: CEC Nasir
item.description: Chief Election Commissioner (CEC) AMM Nasir Uddin on Tuesday called on local election observation organisations not to appoint any person involved in politics or any party as they are field-level observers to ensure their neutral role in the upcoming national election. “Please make sure that

item.title: Metro Rail cards can now be recharged online
item.description: From now on, passengers using the Dhaka Metro Rail can recharge their travel passes online. The service was inaugurated at the capital's Agargaon Metro Station on Tuesday morning. As a result, the Rapid Pass or MRT Pass can be recharged from home or through mobile phones anywhere without waiting

item.title: Mother, two children found dead in suspected murder-suicide in Bogura
item.description: A mother and her two children have been found dead in an apparent case of murder-suicide in Bogura's Shajahanpur Upazila. Law enforcers believe the woman slit the throats of her children before dying by suicide, says Shafiqul Islam, chief of Shajahanpur Police Station. The incident occurred on Tu

item.title: Earthquake: 23 highly vulnerable buildings to be demolished in Sylhet
item.description: Sylhet district administration has decided to demolish 23 buildings identified as highly vulnerable to earthquakes, beginning next week. The decision was made at a meeting on earthquake preparedness and response held at Nagar Bhaban on Monday afternoon, UNB reports. Divisional Commissioner and Sy
